meanings.definition: To act in advance; to take action before something else happens.
meanings.sent1: She decided to preact by studying for the test a week ahead.
meanings.sent2: It is wise to preact by saving money for unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent3: He preacted by bringing an umbrella to the picnic, just in case it rained.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel preacted by gathering extra nuts before the harsh winter.
meanings.sent5: The detective preacted by setting up surveillance before the crime occurred.

meanings.definition: An action taken before another action or event.
meanings.sent1: His decision to make a preact saved him from missing the train.
meanings.sent2: The preact of double-checking the equipment prevented any accidents.
meanings.sent3: The preact of wearing sunscreen indoors made everyone laugh at the beach party.
meanings.sent4: Her preact of bringing a book to the movie theater was quite unusual.
meanings.sent5: The preact of setting up a tent before the camping trip made everything easier.
